bug.author: pawel-ziecina
bug.description: Hi, below is method for "unscreewing the wheels" in most (all?) vehicles. import carla import random c = carla.Client('localhost', 2000) w = c.get_world() vbs = w.get_blueprint_library().filter('vehicle*') vb = random.choice(vbs) sp = w.get_map().get_spawn_points()[0] v = w.spawn_actor(vb, sp) sp.rotation.pitch = -90 sp.location.z = 40 w.get_spectator().set_transform(sp) v.set_simulate_physics(False) v.apply_control(carla.VehicleControl(throttle=10.0)) v.set_simulate_physics(True) OS: Ubuntu 18.04 Carla: 0.9.2 from official release

comments.comment: Why would you want to do that? Of course if you disable physics your car won't move accordingly if you apply control.

It was just play with API. I don't claim it is logic/common sequence of operations. You are right when disabled physics before appling control to car it wouldn't move. But when you enable physics again - car body will move, while wheels will stay in place. I think it is a bug. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1385347/50777409-cbcdbe00-129b-11e9-8d4b-5e7b2df850f6.png></denchmark-link>

This seems to be the same problem as in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/carla-simulator/carla/issues/1001>#1001</denchmark-link> . But in the full list of changes section of the <denchmark-link:http://carla.org/2018/12/24/release-0.9.2/#full-list-of-changes>0.9.2 release,</denchmark-link> it's declared that this problem has been fixed up (the last third line).

You are right - it is the same issue. Confirming that I'm using official 0.9.2 build. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1385347/50817248-83f27980-1323-11e9-8841-d334e73a6fb3.png></denchmark-link>

I think it is related but different than <denchmark-link:https://github.com/carla-simulator/carla/issues/1001>#1001</denchmark-link> , only some vehicles were loosing the wheels and it was due a corruption of their physics asset in UE4. That was already fixed in 0.9.2. Not sure what's causing this, we should investigate.
